For those getting problems when inserting disk 1 again, do the following:

1.Get 7Zip
2.Install it(doh)
3.Make 2 folders, GTA1 and GTA2
4.Instead of mounting the images, extract them into the folders.
5.Take the images in GTA2(NOT the folder, the IMAGES, there should be 2, data-f and data-g) and copy them to the GTA 1 folder(where all the other data files and setup and all that is.)
6.Run setup.

It wont even ask for you to insert disk 2 so you can start it and leave it as it is.

This is how I got it to work
I used Zomane?s instructions for installation:
1.Get 7Zip / or WinRAR
2.Install it(doh)
3.Make 2 folders, GTA1 and GTA2
4.Instead of mounting the images, extract them into the folders.
5.Take the images in GTA2(NOT the folder, the IMAGES, there should be 2, data-f and data-g) and copy them to the GTA 1 folder(where all the other data files and setup and all that is.)
6.Run setup. (Note: it does take over 1 hour)
It won?t even ask for you to insert disk 2 so you can start it and leave it as it is.


To be able to save your game progress:
1In the game, after doing the opening mission or something it will ask you to create a Windows Live account, press yes
2When the Windows Live menu comes up, press create a new account
3Scroll down the long text and click on the blue hyperlink that says something like create local profile or offline
4Enter a name and you are done :)

Here's what I did:
1.Extract DVD 1&2 into seperate folders-Winrar
2.Run Setup From The DVD 1 Folder (No Mounting)
3.Copy data-f and data-g From DVD 2 Folder To DVD 1 Folder (The Installation Will Not Ask For Insert DVD 2 or DVD 1)
4.Let The Installation Finish (ETA 2h)
5.Patch Game With 1.1.1.0 and 1.1.2.0 (Don't Crack The Game)
6.Cracks Will Not Be Needed
7.Play The Game

Zeromant, a repack is a game that has had certain files compressed to reduce overall file size. If the game uses a lot of large video files, the person repacking will usually downgrade the video quality by a certain percentage, which can vastly reduce the overall size of the game by many gigs. Some repacks and rips also convert audio files to mp3's which are, after extraction, converted back to their original formats and placed in, if applicable, whatever base container file they were originally in.

Rips, on the other hand, are traditionally games which have certain files removed altogether. Music might be completely removed, or voice over files, videos, so on and so forth. Most rips these days (usually when it says "FULL Rip") are basically just repacks though, with all gameplay aspects intact after extraction and decompression, so you have to read the description carefully before downloading. You want to generally avoid any altered game that is actually missing gameplay elements like video and sound.

I've played the game through completely, and it works fine. However, as mentioned before, the files have to be extracted before it works.

Extract both .iso's to their folder, copy the contents of the second image to the first one. Namely, data-f.bin and data-g.bin to where all the setup.exe and other files are.

Run setup.exe from there.

I did experience some freezing, about 2-3 times throughout the whole game. Not sure if it is the game or just my system. Regardless, this torrent worked for me using the steps above. Thanks OP.
